title: "Capstone Project: GIS-Based Site Suitability Analysis for Solar Farms in British Columbia, Canada"
image: "suitability_cover.png" 
---

This project evaluates potential locations for utility-scale (1MW+) solar farm development using a GIS-based multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA). The study integrates environmental, technical, and economic considerations to identify areas most suitable for solar farm development. Data incorperated into the mask layer includes:

-   *Agriculture Land Reserve (ALR)*

-   *Water bodies*

-   *Wetlands (treed and non-treed)*

-   *Permanent snow and ice*

-   *Dense forests â€“ canopy cover \> 40%*

-   *Artificial/build environments*

-   *Protected and conserved areas*

-   *Buffers around roads (100m) and major cities (1000m)*

Data incorporated as suitability criterion in the Analytically Hierarchical Process (AHP):

-   *Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI)*

-   *Proximity to roads*

-   *Proximity to major cities*

-   *Proximity to existing energy infrastructure (substations)*

-   *Slope*

-   *Aspect*

Using spatial analysis and weighted overlay techniques, I produced a suitability model that highlights optimal locations while minimizing environmental and land-use conflicts. All processing was completed in R at a spatial resolution of 30m in the BC Environmental Albers CRS (EPSG:3005). Upsampling and re-projection has been undergone for web-publishing.

The project demonstrates the application of geospatial tools to renewable energy planning and supports data-driven decision-making for sustainable infrastructure development.

## Suitability Map

Suitability is ranked on a 1-5 scale, with 1 being least suitable and 5 being very suitable.

The mask layer represents unsuitable land where solar farm installations are not feasible or permitted; it is comprised of data layers mentioned about.

```{r leaflet, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE, messgae = FALSE}

library(terra)
library(leaflet)

#Load web ready data
suitability_small <- rast("C:/Users/kenzthom.stu/OneDrive - UBC/GIT/E-Portfolio/myData/suitability_web.tif")
mask_small <- rast("C:/Users/kenzthom.stu/OneDrive - UBC/GIT/E-Portfolio/myData/mask_web.tif")

#Define Palette
pal <- colorNumeric(
  palette = "RdYlGn", # Built-in Red-Yellow-Green
  domain = values(suitability_small),
  na.color = "transparent")
mask_pal <- colorFactor(palette = "black", domain = values(mask_small), na.color = "transparent")

#Build the Map
l <- leaflet(width = "100%", height = 600) %>%
  addProviderTiles("Esri.WorldImagery", group = "Satellite") %>%
  addProviderTiles("OpenStreetMap", group = "Street Map") %>% # Added a second base map option
  
  #Add Suitability Layer
  addRasterImage(
    suitability_small,
    colors = pal,
    group = "Suitability" # Labeling this group
  ) %>%
  
  # Add Mask Layer
  addRasterImage(
    mask_small,
    colors = mask_pal,
    group = "Mask Layer" # Labeling this group
  ) %>%
  
  addLegend(
    pal = pal, 
    values = values(suitability_small),
    title = "Suitability Score",
    position = "bottomright",
    group = "Suitability", # This links the legend to the Suitability layer toggle
    labFormat = labelFormat(prefix = "")
  ) %>%
  
  # Add the Toggle Control
  addLayersControl(
    baseGroups = c("Satellite", "Street Map"),
    overlayGroups = c("Suitability", "Mask Layer"),
    options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = FALSE) # Keeps the menu open by default
  ) %>%
  
  addScaleBar(position = "bottomleft")

l
```
